title: Monads in R
text: per example , List monad wraps values (may additional lists) flatMaped results ‘flattened’ single List. Note x y print regular lists, remain List monads; print method defined essentially extracts value(x).
code: # identical to a regular Map x <- listM(1, 2, 3) %>>=%   timestwo() x #> [[1]] #> [1] 2 4 6  # only possible with the flatMap approach y <- listM(list(1, 2), list(3, 4, 5)) %>>=%    timestwo() y #> [[1]] #> [1]  2  4  6  8 10

title: Monads in R
text: context include stored ‘log’ expressions used application. One example performing data transformation {dplyr} pipeline (usually use %>% recently |>). required wrap value start pipeline Logger context, achieved calling new() method Logger result still Logger instance, value. extract value can use value(). extract log step, use logger_log() (avoid conflict base::log) works data value, just easily use -memory SQLite database (external) , extracting components Since log captures operations performed, re-run expression, helper available similar functionality present {magrittr} package provides ‘classic’ R pipe %>%; ‘functional sequence’ starts . similarly tracks functions applied arbitrary input evaluated - way, similar defining new function. Since functional sequence unevaluated, errors can present triggered monad context, steps raise error nullify value signifier added log prevent re-running error Aside error destroying value, returning NULL result also produce effect One downside functional sequence approach chaining - since first term must ., always first entry, chaining multiple sequences clean. monad context recreated every step, chaining problem
code: library(dplyr, warn.conflicts = FALSE)  result <- loggerM(mtcars) %>>=%   filter(mpg > 10) %>>=%   select(mpg, cyl, disp) %>>=%   arrange(desc(mpg)) %>>=%   head() value(result) #>                 mpg cyl  disp #> Toyota Corolla 33.9   4  71.1 #> Fiat 128       32.4   4  78.7 #> Honda Civic    30.4   4  75.7 #> Lotus Europa   30.4   4  95.1 #> Fiat X1-9      27.3   4  79.0 #> Porsche 914-2  26.0   4 120.3 logger_log(result) #> ✔ Log of 4 operations: #>  #>  mtcars %>% #>    filter(mpg > 10) %>% #>    select(mpg, cyl, disp) %>% #>    arrange(desc(mpg)) %>% #>    head() mem <- DBI::dbConnect(RSQLite::SQLite(), ":memory:") dplyr::copy_to(mem, mtcars)  res <- loggerM(mem) %>>=%   tbl("mtcars") %>>=%   filter(mpg > 10) %>>=%   select(mpg, cyl, disp) %>>=%   arrange(desc(mpg)) %>>=%   head() value(res) #> # Source:     SQL [6 x 3] #> # Database:   sqlite 3.46.0 [:memory:] #> # Ordered by: desc(mpg) #>     mpg   cyl  disp #>   <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> #> 1  33.9     4  71.1 #> 2  32.4     4  78.7 #> 3  30.4     4  75.7 #> 4  30.4     4  95.1 #> 5  27.3     4  79   #> 6  26       4 120. logger_log(res) #> ✔ Log of 5 operations: #>  #>  mem %>% #>    tbl("mtcars") %>% #>    filter(mpg > 10) %>% #>    select(mpg, cyl, disp) %>% #>    arrange(desc(mpg)) %>% #>    head() rerun(res) #> # Source:     SQL [6 x 3] #> # Database:   sqlite 3.46.0 [:memory:] #> # Ordered by: desc(mpg) #>     mpg   cyl  disp #>   <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> #> 1  33.9     4  71.1 #> 2  32.4     4  78.7 #> 3  30.4     4  75.7 #> 4  30.4     4  95.1 #> 5  27.3     4  79   #> 6  26       4 120. library(magrittr)  # define a functional sequence fs <- . %>%   tbl("mtcars") %>%   select(cyl, mpg)  # evaluate the functional sequence with some input data fs(mem) #> # Source:   SQL [?? x 2] #> # Database: sqlite 3.46.0 [:memory:] #>      cyl   mpg #>    <dbl> <dbl> #>  1     6  21   #>  2     6  21   #>  3     4  22.8 #>  4     6  21.4 #>  5     8  18.7 #>  6     6  18.1 #>  7     8  14.3 #>  8     4  24.4 #>  9     4  22.8 #> 10     6  19.2 #> # ℹ more rows  # identify the function calls at each step of the pipeline magrittr::functions(fs) #> [[1]] #> function (.)  #> tbl(., "mtcars") #>  #> [[2]] #> function (.)  #> select(., cyl, mpg) errfs <- . %>%   sqrt() %>%   stop("oops") %>%   add_n(3)  x <- 1:10  errfs(x) #> Error in function_list[[i]](value): 11.41421356237311.7320508075688822.236067977499792.449489742783182.645751311064592.8284271247461933.16227766016838oops magrittr::functions(errfs) #> [[1]] #> function (.)  #> sqrt(.) #>  #> [[2]] #> function (.)  #> stop(., "oops") #>  #> [[3]] #> function (.)  #> add_n(., 3) resx <- loggerM(x) %>>=%   sqrt() %>>=%   add_n(4)  value(resx) #>  [1] 5.000000 5.414214 5.732051 6.000000 6.236068 6.449490 6.645751 6.828427 #>  [9] 7.000000 7.162278 logger_log(resx) #> ✔ Log of 2 operations: #>  #>  x %>% #>    sqrt() %>% #>    add_n(4)  err <- loggerM(x) %>>=%   sqrt() %>>=%   stop("oops") %>>=%   add_n(3)  value(err) #> NULL logger_log(err) #> ✖ Log of 3 operations: [ERROR] #>  #>  x %>% #>    sqrt() %>% #>    [E] stop("oops") %>% #>    [E] add_n(3) nullify <- loggerM(x) %>>=%   sqrt() %>>=%   ret_null() %>>=%   add_n(7)  value(nullify) #> NULL logger_log(nullify) #> ✖ Log of 3 operations: [ERROR] #>  #>  x %>% #>    sqrt() %>% #>    [E] ret_null() %>% #>    [E] add_n(7) a <- . %>% sqrt() a #> Functional sequence with the following components: #>  #>  1. sqrt(.) #>  #> Use 'functions' to extract the individual functions.  b <- . %>% a %>% add_n(1) b #> Functional sequence with the following components: #>  #>  1. a(.) #>  2. add_n(., 1) #>  #> Use 'functions' to extract the individual functions.  b(x) #>  [1] 2.000000 2.414214 2.732051 3.000000 3.236068 3.449490 3.645751 3.828427 #>  [9] 4.000000 4.162278 a <- loggerM(x) %>>=%   sqrt()  value(a) #>  [1] 1.000000 1.414214 1.732051 2.000000 2.236068 2.449490 2.645751 2.828427 #>  [9] 3.000000 3.162278 logger_log(a) #> ✔ Log of 1 operations: #>  #>  x %>% #>    sqrt()  b <- a %>>=%   add_n(1)  value(b) #>  [1] 2.000000 2.414214 2.732051 3.000000 3.236068 3.449490 3.645751 3.828427 #>  [9] 4.000000 4.162278 logger_log(b) #> ✔ Log of 2 operations: #>  #>  x %>% #>    sqrt() %>% #>    add_n(1)

title: Monads in R
text: addition capturing expressions log, Timer monad also captures evaluation timing step, storing alongside expressions data.frame
code: x <- timerM(5) %>>=%   sleep_for(3) %>>=%   timestwo() %>>=%   sleep_for(1.3)  value(x) #> [1] 10 times(x) #>             expr  time #> 1              5 0.000 #> 2   sleep_for(3) 3.003 #> 3     timestwo() 0.000 #> 4 sleep_for(1.3) 1.302  y <- timerM(5) %>>=%   sleep_for(2) %>>=%   ret_null() %>>=%   sleep_for(0.3)  value(y) #> NULL times(y) #>             expr  time #> 1              5 0.000 #> 2   sleep_for(2) 2.003 #> 3     ret_null() 0.000 #> 4 sleep_for(0.3) 0.300

title: Monads in R
text: languages preferrable return something rather raising error, particularly want ensure errors handled. Maybe pattern consists either Nothing (empty) Just containing value; functions applied Maybe one . testing result, helpers is_nothing() is_just() defined. likely much robust implementation, see {maybe}.
code: x <- maybeM(9) %>>=%    sqrt() %>>=%   timestwo()  value(x) #> Just: #> [1] 6 is_just(x) #> [1] TRUE is_nothing(x) #> [1] FALSE  y <- maybeM(Nothing()) %>>=%   sqrt()  value(y) #> Nothing is_just(y) #> [1] FALSE is_nothing(y) #> [1] TRUE  z <- maybeM(10) %>>=%   timestwo() %>>=%   add_n(Nothing())  value(z) #> Nothing is_just(z) #> [1] FALSE is_nothing(z) #> [1] TRUE

title: Monads in R
text: Similar Maybe, Result can contain either successful Ok wrapped value Err wrapped message, one . pattern resembles (internally, uses) tryCatch() approach evaluation fail, requires testing produced determine success, is_ok() is_err() defined. evaluation fails, error reported, along value prior error
code: x <- resultM(9) %>>=%    sqrt() %>>=%   timestwo()  value(x) #> OK: #> [1] 6 is_err(x) #> [1] FALSE is_ok(x) #> [1] TRUE y <- resultM(9) %>>=%   sqrt() %>>=%   ret_err("this threw an error")  value(y) #> Error: #> [1] "this threw an error; previously: 3" is_err(y) #> [1] TRUE is_ok(y) #> [1] FALSE  z <- resultM(10) %>>=%   timestwo() %>>=%   add_n("banana")  value(z) #> Error: #> [1] "n should be numeric; previously: 20" is_err(z) #> [1] TRUE is_ok(z) #> [1] FALSE

title: Monads in R
text: flatMap/“bind” operator defined %>>=% applicable monad bind() method defined. monads defined package R6Class objects exposing method form m$bind(.call, .quo) expects function quosure. can add extensions defining class (probably constructor helper print() method) just toy example; attempting cat() data.frame result go well.
code: # a Reporter monad which reports unpiped function calls Reporter <- R6::R6Class(   c("ReporterMonad"),   public = list(     value = NULL,     initialize = function(value) {       if (rlang::is_quosure(value)) {         self$value <- rlang::eval_tidy(value)       } else {         self$value <- value       }     },     bind = function(f, expr) {       ## 'undo' the pipe and inject the lhs as an argument       result <- unlist(lapply(unlist(self$value), f))       args <- as.list(c(self$value, rlang::call_args(expr)))       fnew <- rlang::call2(rlang::call_name(expr), !!!args)       cat(" ** Calculating:", rlang::quo_text(fnew), "=", result, "\n")       Reporter$new(result)     }   ) )  reporterM <- function(value) {   v <- rlang::enquo(value)   Reporter$new(v) }  print.Reporter <- function(x, ...) {   print(value(x)) }  x <- reporterM(17) %>>=%   timestwo() %>>=%   square() %>>=%    add_n(2) %>>=%   `/`(8) #>  ** Calculating: timestwo(17) = 34  #>  ** Calculating: square(34) = 1156  #>  ** Calculating: add_n(1156, 2) = 1158  #>  ** Calculating: 1158/8 = 144.75  value(x) #> [1] 144.75

title: Authors and Citation
text: Carroll J (2024). monads: Provides Common Monad Patterns flatMap. R package version 0.1.0.9000, https://jonocarroll.github.io/monads/, https://github.com/jonocarroll/monads.
code: @Manual{,   title = {monads: Provides Common Monad Patterns and a flatMap},   author = {Jonathan Carroll},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.1.0.9000, https://jonocarroll.github.io/monads/},   url = {https://github.com/jonocarroll/monads}, }

what: Provides Common Monad Patterns and a flatMap
title: Provides Common Monad Patterns and a flatMap
text: goal monads provide ‘toy’ implementation common monads. See blog post additional background.

title: Provides Common Monad Patterns and a flatMap
text: can install development version monads like :

title: Provides Common Monad Patterns and a flatMap
text: addition new ‘flatMap’ pipe %>>=% monad instance can passed regular functions, unpacked, applied, re-packaged. One example create ‘logger’ records function applications step. package also defines Maybe, Result, Timer, List monads work new pipe. Additional monads can added third-parties extend capabilities. See vignette details.
code: library(monads) library(dplyr, warn.conflicts = FALSE)  result <- loggerM(mtcars) %>>=%   filter(mpg > 10) %>>=%   select(mpg, cyl, disp) %>>=%   arrange(desc(mpg)) %>>=%   head()  value(result) #>                 mpg cyl  disp #> Toyota Corolla 33.9   4  71.1 #> Fiat 128       32.4   4  78.7 #> Honda Civic    30.4   4  75.7 #> Lotus Europa   30.4   4  95.1 #> Fiat X1-9      27.3   4  79.0 #> Porsche 914-2  26.0   4 120.3  logger_log(result) #> ✔ Log of 4 operations: #>  #>  mtcars %>% #>    filter(mpg > 10) %>% #>    select(mpg, cyl, disp) %>% #>    arrange(desc(mpg)) %>% #>    head()

title: Provides Common Monad Patterns and a flatMap
text: {monads} - sketched-implementation relies dispatch flatMap operations. {rmonad} - archived CRAN, offers sophisticated ‘funnel’ mechanism various ways capture steps pipeline. {maybe} - detailed implementation Maybe. {chronicler} - way post-process result step capture information, runtime (see Timer) dimensions. Requires explicit bind() step. Associated blog post.

title: List Monad — List
text: Creates List monad instance can used flatMap operator %>>=%. See Monads R vignette details. container, flatMapped, unpacks contained values, concatenates , passes next expression, rewraps result new List.

title: List Monad — List
text: f function apply expr expression function

title: Logger Monad — Logger
text: Creates Logger monad instance can used flatMap operator %>>=%. See Monads R vignette details. container, flatMapped, records expressions used step, can recovered object, potentially re-evaluation.

title: Logger Monad — Logger
text: value value contained instance log log evaluated expressions

title: Logger Monad — Logger
text: f function apply expr expression function

title: Maybe Monad — Maybe
text: Creates Maybe monad instance can used flatMap operator %>>=%. See Monads R vignette details. container, flatMapped, always returns value, either type Nothing (error raised result NULL), Just.

title: Maybe Monad — Maybe
text: f function apply expr expression function

title: Result Monad — Result
text: Creates Result monad instance can used flatMap operator %>>=%. See Monads R vignette details. container, flatMapped, always returns value, either type Err (error raised result NULL), Ok.

title: Result Monad — Result
text: f function apply expr expression function

title: Timer Monad — Timer
text: Creates Timer monad instance can used flatMap operator %>>=%. See Monads R vignette details. container, flatMapped, records evaluation time expressions used step, can recovered object, along expressions .

title: Timer Monad — Timer
text: $new(value) creates new instance wrapping value. $bind() used within %>>=% re-wraps new Timer. $value extracts value field. value(x) wrapper . $times extracts times field. times(x) wrapper .

title: Timer Monad — Timer
text: value value contained instance times evaluation times

title: Timer Monad — Timer
text: f function apply expr expression function

title: flatMap — %>>=%
